title: 115_hr1567
content:
The Act may be cited as the "United States-Mexico Economic Partnership Act". Congress finds that the United States and Mexico have a mutually beneficial partnership focused on advancing economic interests. Mexico's energy reforms in 2013 opened its sector to private investment, increasing energy cooperation with the United States. Exchange programs are crucial in advancing U.S. national security and economic interests. The 100,000 Strong in the Americas Initiative aims to increase educational exchanges between the United States and other countries in the Western Hemisphere region, with a focus on having 100,000 U.S. students studying in other countries. The United States has established the 100,000 Strong in the Americas Innovation Fund to promote educational exchanges in the Western Hemisphere region. Over 100 grants have been awarded to 250 institutions from 25 countries, raising $9 million in investments. The United States has established the 100,000 Strong in the Americas Innovation Fund to promote educational exchanges in the Western Hemisphere region. It has raised $9,000,000 in investments, with 75 percent coming from corporations, foundations, and regional governments. The United States aims to deepen economic cooperation with Mexico and expand educational and professional exchange programs, including through the 100,000 Strong in the Americas Initiative. The Secretary of State will develop a strategy to prioritize and expand educational and professional exchange programs with Mexico under the 100,000 Strong in the Americas Initiative. This includes encouraging academic exchanges at various levels and promoting collaboration between US and Mexican institutions for business development and joint initiatives. The strategy aims to promote energy infrastructure coordination and cooperation through education and partnerships between universities in the United States and medical school and nursing programs in Mexico to ensure comparable accreditation standards. The Secretary of State must submit a report to Congress within 180 days of the enactment of this Act on the strategy for promoting energy infrastructure coordination and cooperation through education and partnerships between universities in the United States and medical school and nursing programs in Mexico to ensure accreditation standards. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS.

(1) 100,000 Strong in the Americas Initiative - Initiative established in March 2011 by the United States Government to increase educational exchanges in the Western Hemisphere.
(2) Covered United States-Mexico border region - Portions of the United States and Mexico within 100 kilometers of the international boundary between the countries.
